content.description:
P1: Start up the pinnacle pulling onto a brief slab section that can be climbed on a large flake to the right. Branch right, and pull through a brief steeper section of rock to the anchor/rap station.

P2: Straight up through easier terrain to the anchors!

Walk off climbers right, or 2 raps.



The second bolt line- starts up a pinnacle heading for the easily identifiable low slab section. Branch right at the top of the slab following the bolt line.

12 (+) bolts

You might consider bringing a light rack (nuts/cams to hands).

P1: Aim for the bolt heading up the steep toe of the ramp to an off-width crack (no need to climb it as an off-width). Turn on to lower angle terrain and head for the belay/rap station up and left on the ramp. 

P2: Continue straight up from the belay heading for the short, steeper portion of the wall that defines the right border of the ramp. Pull the steep section (crux, bolt protected) and head up easy slab to the anchors.

Walk off (climbers right) or 2 <30 m raps. 



First bolt line at the left end of First Wall. Straight up from the mid-point anchors. 

Bolts (minimum 6 QD's), optional light rack

You might consider bringing a light rack (nuts/cams to hands).

P1: Aim for the bolt heading up the steep toe of the ramp to an off-width crack (no need to climb it as an off-width). Turn on to lower angle terrain and head for the belay/rap station up and left on the ramp. 

P2: Continue straight up from the belay heading for the short, steeper portion of the wall that defines the right border of the ramp. Cross right through the steep section (crux, bolt protected) and head up easy slab to the anchors.

Walk off (climbers right) or 2 <30 m raps. 



First bolt line at the left end of First Wall. Straight up from the mid-point anchors, taking the bolt line that veers right. 

Bolts (at least 6 QD's), optional light rack

P1: Absolutely stellar dihedral, elegant and creative movement required! First bolt is high, but easy enough. 

P2: Much less remarkable, easier climbing (slab)

Walk off climbers right or 2 raps. First pitch is the money pitch, consider bailing happy at the first anchor/belay station.



3rd bolt line from the left- look for the prominent dihedral (orange on the left wall, grey on the right) that starts behind a pine tree.

9(+) bolts

Start up the pinnacle pulling onto a brief slab section that can be climbed on a large flake to the right. The slab ends abruptly at steep, darker/orange rock. Head up the bolt line (crux, sustained) before once again reaching slab. Blast up the slab to the anchors. Cruisey!

Walk off, or 2 raps from either of the anchor stations to your left (EuroSport/Trad) or to your right (Daisy Head Maisey).



The second bolt line- starts up a pinnacle heading for the easily identifiable low slab section. 

12 (+) bolts

P1: Scramble up on mostly 4th class/very low 5th to a 2 pin belay (connected by cord)- loose, difficult to protect, but easy.

P2: From the pin belay, either cross the gully and pull up on big, loose holds through the weakness in the steeper rock (scary 5.5), or continue up the ramp and climb the steeper rock at your discretion to a belay station (5.3). 

Walk off (climbers right of the wall) or 2 <30 m raps from the "Euro Sport/Trad" anchors gets you to the base!



Far left of the wall, prominent gully/ramp feature with a tree at the base. 

Probably none, but, standard rack

You might consider bringing a light rack.

P1: Aim for the bolt heading up the steep toe of the ramp to an off-width crack (no need to climb it as an off-width). Turn on to lower angle terrain and head for the belay/rap station up and left on the ramp. 

P2: Blast up the ramp aiming for the tree - hook right to the "EuroSport/Trad" anchors to rap out, or continue straight to alternative anchors. 

Conceivably can be done as a single pitch. 



First climb on the "First Wall" proper (far left, just before the gully). Prominent left leaning grey ramp with a tree at the top.

Bolts, maybe 6, optional light rack of nuts/cams to hands

First Wall hosts several 2 pitch/ long single pitch, low grade slab climbs, as well as a few moderates towards the right end of the wall. Most routes can be climbed with quick draws alone as many routes have been retro-bolted; however, there may be slight run-outs that could be easily mitigated with gear (nuts/ tips to small hands cams), and you may clip the occasional pin or knife blade. Rock can be loose down low, but is solid on the head wall. Anchors are bolted, and the top anchors can be accessed by scrambling to the top from the right end of the wall. Most routes can be rapped in 2
